title: Global warming will not cause sea level decrease

content.prompt: Which of the following scenarios is NOT likely to result from increased temperatures in the Arctic?

choices.label: Increased numbers of mosquitoes drive caribou to higher, cooler elevations where there is less vegetation.
Increased melting of the permafrost increases the amount of methane that escapes into the atmosphere, which increases the temperature even more.

Increased melting of sea ice decreases travel distance for ships but increases the distance that polar bears and other Arctic species have to travel to find food, thus leading to their possible extinction.
Increased melting of the permafrost decreases the number of days that large vehicles can travel over the area to transport drilling equipment to extract oil from the region.
Increased melting of sea ice decreases the sea level and leads to more arable land area that can be farmed.
